comment.author: 35468140263@N01
comment._content: Possibly Haapi www.ancientnile.co.uk/gods.php Haapi was regarded as the 'Spirit of the Nile'. The annual inundation was the arrival of Haapi and it was believed he had a cavern in the first cataract of the Nile at Aswan, from where he discharged the rising waters. Along with Nephthys, his wife, Haapi guarded the canopic jar which contained Pharaoh's lungs and whose stopper was the head of a baboon. DEPICTION: Well fed man with a headdress of Nile plants. "

comment._content: Beautiful combination of sculpture and relief - really exciting!
